description: This course is an introduction to cloud computing.
Students will learn about the different types of cloud computing, the benefits of cloud computing, and the different cloud service providers.
Students will also learn how to create and manage virtual machines in the cloud, how to create and manage storage in the cloud, and how to create and manage databases in the cloud.
The course will also cover the different cloud computing models, such as Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Platform as a Service (PaaS), and Software as a Service (SaaS).
course.prerequisites: CNT 4502 with a grade of C or better

outcomes.CLO #1: Identify standards, best practices, and policies of cloud computing management.
outcomes.CLO #2: Configure and Deploy cloud services including web applications, and serverless functions.

objectives.LO #1: Master the concepts and principles of cloud computing.
objectives.LO #2: Explain the basic concepts of cloud computing.
objectives.LO #4: Explain methods of managing cloud computing systems.
objectives.LO #5: Identify standards, best practices, and policies of cloud computing management.
objectives.LO #6: Describe cloud services; SaaS, PaaS, IaaS, IDaaS.
objectives.LO #8: Identify advantages and disadvantages of cloud-based storage.
objectives.LO #9: Explain best practices when collaborating in the clouds.
objectives.LO #10: Demonstrate professional level skills in the areas of disaster recovery and business continuity and the cloud.
objectives.LO #11: Explain service-oriented architectures and web services.
objectives.LO #12: Master techniques of using Infrastructure-as-a-Service, (IaaS), Platform-as-a-Service (Paas) and Big Data systems.
objectives.LO #13: Master the techniques of developing, deploying, and managing cloud applications major topics: Introduction background and history of cloud computing, cloud computing concepts, cloud computing models with virtualization background and history of virtualization, virtual machines, virtual networks, virtual storage IaaS system architecture, IaaS programming, PaaS System Architecture, PaaS Programming, Big Data system architecture and Big Data programming.

contact.about:
preferred method of contact is via email. I will respond to emails within 24 hours on weekdays. Published office hours are times when I will be available on Zoom for real-time communication. If you need to meet at a different time, please email me to schedule an appointment.
Discord channels are also available for anytime communication with me and your classmates.

instructor.about: Over 30 years professional experience as a software engineer and program manager. I have worked for large and small companies.
